table.name: Message
table.description: This table stores all information about messages that can be passed back and forth between people in the application. Conceptually, all messages are like e-mail messages and allow the same types of functions i.e. To, Cc, Bcc, Fwd, Attachments etc.

column.name: message_id
column.descr: Unique Document ID for each message record stored in this table

column.name: parent_id
column.descr: The Artifact record that this record elaborates upon

column.name: subject
column.descr: The subject of this message. This will probably be shown to the user when displaying the 'list of messages'

column.name: sender_id
column.descr: The sender of the message. This can be only one person. Since the message itself can have multiple recipients, those will be stored separately

column.name: content
column.descr: The actual content of the message

table.name: Message_Recipient
table.description: This table stores all information about whom a particular message is going to. It stores all the To, Cc, and Bcc recipients.

column.name: system_id
column.descr: Unique System ID for each row

column.name: message_id
column.descr: The actual message that this recipient is meant to get

column.name: recipient_type_id
column.descr: What type of recipient is this? Application-level or Internet

column.name: reception_type_id
column.descr: What type of recipient is this? To, Cc or Bcc?

column.name: recipient_id
column.descr: The person to whom this message is going

table.name: Message_Attach
table.description: This table stores all information about file and message attachments associated with a message. File attachments are used to associate Documents (already stored in the application) with a message. Message attachments are used to associate existing messages with a message - similar to forwarding a message.

column.name: system_id
column.descr: Unique System ID for each row

column.name: message_id
column.descr: The actual message that this recipient is meant to get

column.name: attachment_type_id
column.descr: What type of attachment is this? File or Message?

column.name: document_id
column.descr: A document that is attached to this message

column.name: forwarded_id
column.descr: A pre-existing message that is attached to this message. constraint: forwarded_id != message_id
